intro: Ribes rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaf gooseberry, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of flowering plants in the family Grossulariaceae. The plant is characterized by its oval, waxy leaves that are typically rounded at the base. It produces small, yellowish-green berries that are edible and often used in jams and jellies. The shrub thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
